post.description:
Returns users visible to the user, sorted by descending `created_at`.

Admins see all non-deleted users. Non-admins only see themselves.

The results are paginated. To get the next page, pass `created_at` and `id` of
the last user from the previous page as `prev_created_at` and `prev_id`.

schema.title: Response List Users Api Users List Post

post.description: Returns OAuth2 providers registered on the server.

schema.title: Response List Providers Api Auth List Providers Post

post.description:
A helper endpoint that returns the next redirect URL in case the state encodes it.
Can be used by the UI after the redirect from the provider
to determine if the user needs to be redirected further (CLI login)
or the auth callback endpoint needs to be called directly (UI login).

Returns projects visible to the user.

Returns all accessible projects (member projects for regular users, all non-deleted
projects for global admins, plus public projects if `include_not_joined` is `True`).

`members` and `backends` are always empty - call `/api/projects/{project_name}/get` to retrieve them.

schema.title: Response List Projects Api Projects List Post

post.description:
Returns only projects where the user is a member and that have no active fleets,
sorted by ascending `created_at`.

Active fleets are those with `deleted == False`. Projects with deleted fleets
(but no active fleets) are included.

`members` and `backends` are always empty - call `/api/projects/{project_name}/get` to retrieve them.

schema.title: Response List Only No Fleets Api Projects List Only No Fleets Post
Response Create Backend Api Project  Project Name  Backends Create Post
Response Update Backend Api Project  Project Name  Backends Update Post
Response Get Backend Config Info Api Project  Project Name  Backends  Backend Name  Config Info Post

post.description:
Returns all fleets and instances within them visible to user sorted by descending `created_at`.
`project_name` and `only_active` can be specified as filters.
Includes only active fleet instances. To list all fleet instances, use `/api/instances/list`.

The results are paginated. To get the next page, pass `created_at` and `id` of
the last fleet from the previous page as `prev_created_at` and `prev_id`.

schema.title: Response List Fleets Api Fleets List Post

post.description:
Returns all fleets in the project.
Includes only active fleet instances. To list all fleet instances, use `/api/instances/list`.

schema.title: Response List Project Fleets Api Project  Project Name  Fleets List Post

post.description:
Returns a fleet given `name` or `id`.
If given `name`, does not return deleted fleets.
If given `id`, returns deleted fleets.
Returns a fleet plan for the given fleet configuration.

Creates a new fleet or updates an existing fleet.
Errors if the expected current resource from the plan does not match the current resource.
Use `force: true` to apply even if the current resource does not match.
Creates a fleet given a fleet configuration.
Deletes one or more fleets.
Deletes one or more instances within the fleet.

Returns all instances visible to user sorted by descending `created_at`.
`project_names` and `fleet_ids` can be specified as filters.

The results are paginated. To get the next page, pass `created_at` and `id` of
the last instance from the previous page as `prev_created_at` and `prev_id`.

schema.title: Response List Instances Api Instances List Post
Response List Repos Api Project  Project Name  Repos List Post

post.description:
Creates or updates a repo with the repo info and repo creds.
Runs belong to repos, so this endpoint must be called before applying run configurations.
You can create `virtual` repos if you don't use git repos.

Returns all runs visible to user sorted by descending `submitted_at`.
`project_name`, `repo_id`, `username`, and `only_active` can be specified as filters.
Setting `only_active` to `true` excludes finished runs and deleted runs.
Specifying `repo_id` without `project_name` returns no runs.

The results are paginated. To get the next page, pass `submitted_at` and `id` of
the last run from the previous page as `prev_submitted_at` and `prev_run_id`.

schema.title: Response List Runs Api Runs List Post

post.description:
Returns a run given `run_name` or `id`.
If given `run_name`, does not return deleted runs.
If given `id`, returns deleted runs.

Returns a run plan for the given run spec.
This is an optional step before calling `/apply`.

Creates a new run or updates an existing run.
Errors if the expected current resource from the plan does not match the current resource.
Use `force: true` to apply even if the current resource does not match.
If the existing run is active and cannot be updated, it must be stopped first.
Stop one or more runs.
Delete one or more runs. The runs must be stopped before they can be deleted.

get.description:
Returns job-level metrics such as hardware utilization
given `run_name`, `run_id`, `replica_num`, and `job_num`.
If only `run_name` is specified, returns metrics of `(replica_num=0, job_num=0)`
of the latest run with the given name.
By default, returns one latest sample. To control time window/number of samples, use
`limit`, `after`, `before`.

Supported metrics (all optional):
* `cpus_detected_num`
* `cpu_usage_percent`
* `memory_total_bytes`
* `memory_usage_bytes`
* `memory_working_set_bytes`
* `gpus_detected_num`
* `gpu_memory_total_bytes`
* `gpu_memory_usage_bytes_gpu{i}`
* `gpu_util_percent_gpu{i}`

schema.title: Response List Secrets Api Project  Project Name  Secrets List Post
Response List Gateways Api Project  Project Name  Gateways List Post

post.description:
Returns all volumes visible to user sorted by descending `created_at`.
`project_name` and `only_active` can be specified as filters.

The results are paginated. To get the next page, pass `created_at` and `id` of
the last fleet from the previous page as `prev_created_at` and `prev_id`.

schema.title: Response List Volumes Api Volumes List Post

post.description: Returns all volumes in the project.

schema.title: Response List Project Volumes Api Project  Project Name  Volumes List Post

post.description: Returns a volume given a volume name.
Creates a volume given a volume configuration.
Deletes one or more volumes.

Returns events visible to the current user.

Regular users can see events related to themselves and to projects they are members of.
Global admins can see all events.

The results are paginated. To get the next page, pass `recorded_at` and `id` of
the last event from the previous page as `prev_recorded_at` and `prev_id`.

schema.title: Response List Events Api Events List Post

arn.title: Arn
arn.description: The ARN of the wildcard ACM certificate for the domain

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of AWS regions. Omit to use all regions

vpc_name.title: Vpc Name
vpc_name.description: The name of custom VPCs. All configured regions must have a VPC with this name. If your custom VPCs don't have names or have different names in different regions, use `vpc_ids` instead.

vpc_ids.title: Vpc Ids
vpc_ids.description: The mapping from AWS regions to VPC IDs. If `default_vpcs: true`, omitted regions will use default VPCs

default_vpcs.title: Default Vpcs
default_vpcs.description: A flag to enable/disable using default VPCs in regions not configured by `vpc_ids`. Set to `false` if default VPCs should never be used. Defaults to `true`

public_ips.title: Public Ips
public_ips.description: A flag to enable/disable public IP assigning on instances. `public_ips: false` requires at least one private subnet with outbound internet connectivity provided by a NAT Gateway or a Transit Gateway. Defaults to `true`

iam_instance_profile.title: Iam Instance Profile
iam_instance_profile.description: The name of the IAM instance profile to associate with EC2 instances. You can also specify the IAM role name for roles created via the AWS console. AWS automatically creates an instance profile and gives it the same name as the role

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The tags that will be assigned to resources created by `dstack`

os_images.title: Os Images
os_images.description: The mapping of instance categories (CPU, NVIDIA GPU) to AMI configurations

vpc_ids.title: Vpc Ids
vpc_ids.description: The mapping from AWS regions to VPC IDs. If `default_vpcs: true`, omitted regions will use default VPCs

default_vpcs.title: Default Vpcs
default_vpcs.description: A flag to enable/disable using default VPCs in regions not configured by `vpc_ids`. Set to `false` if default VPCs should never be used. Defaults to `true`

public_ips.title: Public Ips
public_ips.description: A flag to enable/disable public IP assigning on instances. `public_ips: false` requires at least one private subnet with outbound internet connectivity provided by a NAT Gateway or a Transit Gateway. Defaults to `true`

iam_instance_profile.title: Iam Instance Profile
iam_instance_profile.description: The name of the IAM instance profile to associate with EC2 instances. You can also specify the IAM role name for roles created via the AWS console. AWS automatically creates an instance profile and gives it the same name as the role

cpu.description: The AMI used for CPU instances

nvidia.title: Nvidia
nvidia.description: The AMI used for NVIDIA GPU instances

owner.title: Owner
owner.description: The AMI owner, account ID or `self`

current_resource.description: The expected current resource. If the resource has changed, the apply fails unless `force: true`.

force.title: Force
force.description: Use `force: true` to apply even if the expected resource does not match.

current_resource.title: Current Resource
current_resource.description: The expected current resource. If the resource has changed, the apply fails unless `force: true`.

force.title: Force
force.description: Use `force: true` to apply even if the expected resource does not match.

resource_group.title: Resource Group
resource_group.description: The resource group for resources created by `dstack`. If not specified, `dstack` will create a new resource group

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Azure regions (locations). Omit to use all regions

vpc_ids.title: Vpc Ids
vpc_ids.description: The mapping from configured Azure locations to network IDs. A network ID must have a format `networkResourceGroup/networkName` If not specified, `dstack` will create a new network for every configured region

public_ips.title: Public Ips
public_ips.description: A flag to enable/disable public IP assigning on instances. `public_ips: false` requires `vpc_ids` that specifies custom networks with outbound internet connectivity provided by NAT Gateway or other mechanism. Defaults to `true`

vm_managed_identity.title: Vm Managed Identity
vm_managed_identity.description: The managed identity to associate with provisioned VMs. Must have a format `managedIdentityResourceGroup/managedIdentityName`

tags.description: The tags that will be assigned to resources created by `dstack`

vpc_ids.title: Vpc Ids

public_ips.title: Public Ips

vm_managed_identity.title: Vm Managed Identity
vm_managed_identity.description: The managed identity to associate with provisioned VMs. Must have a format `managedIdentityResourceGroup/managedIdentityName`

tags.description: The tags that will be assigned to resources created by `dstack`

BackendType.title: BackendType
BackendType.description:
Attributes:
    AMDDEVCLOUD (BackendType): AMD Developer Cloud
    AWS (BackendType): Amazon Web Services
    AZURE (BackendType): Microsoft Azure
    CLOUDRIFT (BackendType): CloudRift
    CUDO (BackendType): Cudo
    DATACRUNCH (BackendType): DataCrunch (for backward compatibility)
    DIGITALOCEAN (BackendType): DigitalOcean
    DSTACK (BackendType): dstack Sky
    GCP (BackendType): Google Cloud Platform
    HOTAISLE (BackendType): Hot Aisle
    KUBERNETES (BackendType): Kubernetes
    LAMBDA (BackendType): Lambda Cloud
    NEBIUS (BackendType): Nebius AI Cloud
    OCI (BackendType): Oracle Cloud Infrastructure
    RUNPOD (BackendType): Runpod Cloud
    TENSORDOCK (BackendType): TensorDock Marketplace
    VASTAI (BackendType): Vast.ai Marketplace
    VERDA (BackendType): Verda Cloud
    VULTR (BackendType): Vultr

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of CloudRift regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of CloudRift regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Cudo regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Cudo regions. Omit to use all regions

ide.title: Ide
ide.description: The IDE to run. Supported values include `vscode`, `cursor`, and `windsurf`

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the IDE. For `windsurf`, the version is in the format `version@commit`

init.title: Init
init.description: The shell commands to run on startup

inactivity_duration.title: Inactivity Duration
inactivity_duration.description: The maximum amount of time the dev environment can be inactive (e.g., `2h`, `1d`, etc). After it elapses, the dev environment is automatically stopped. Inactivity is defined as the absence of SSH connections to the dev environment, including VS Code connections, `ssh <run name>` shells, and attached `dstack apply` or `dstack attach` commands. Use `off` for unlimited duration. Can be updated in-place. Defaults to `off`

name.title: Name
name.description: The run name. If not specified, a random name is generated

image.title: Image
image.description: The name of the Docker image to run

user.title: User
user.description: The user inside the container, `user_name_or_id[:group_name_or_id]` (e.g., `ubuntu`, `1000:1000`). Defaults to the default user from the `image`

privileged.title: Privileged
privileged.description: Run the container in privileged mode

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: The absolute path to the working directory inside the container. Defaults to the `image`'s default working directory

registry_auth.title: Registry Auth
registry_auth.description: Credentials for pulling a private Docker image

python.description: The major version of Python. Mutually exclusive with `image` and `docker`

nvcc.title: Nvcc
nvcc.description: Use image with NVIDIA CUDA Compiler (NVCC) included. Mutually exclusive with `image` and `docker`

single_branch.title: Single Branch
single_branch.description: Whether to clone and track only the current branch or all remote branches. Relevant only when using remote Git repos. Defaults to `false` for dev environments and to `true` for tasks and services

env.title: Env
env.description: The mapping or the list of environment variables

shell.title: Shell
shell.description: The shell used to run commands. Allowed values are `sh`, `bash`, or an absolute path, e.g., `/usr/bin/zsh`. Defaults to `/bin/sh` if the `image` is specified, `/bin/bash` otherwise

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: The resources requirements to run the configuration

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of the run, an integer between `0` and `100`. `dstack` tries to provision runs with higher priority first. Defaults to `0`

docker.title: Docker
docker.description: Use Docker inside the container. Mutually exclusive with `image`, `python`, and `nvcc`. Overrides `privileged`

files.title: Files
files.description: The local to container file path mappings

backends.description: The backends to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[aws, gcp]`)

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The regions to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1, us-west4, westeurope]`)

availability_zones.title: Availability Zones
availability_zones.description: The availability zones to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1a, us-west4-a]`)

instance_types.title: Instance Types
instance_types.description: The cloud-specific instance types to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[p3.8xlarge, n1-standard-4]`)

reservation.title: Reservation
reservation.description: The existing reservation to use for instance provisioning. Supports AWS Capacity Reservations, AWS Capacity Blocks, and GCP reservations

spot_policy.description: The policy for provisioning spot or on-demand instances: `spot`, `on-demand`, `auto`. Defaults to `on-demand`

retry.title: Retry
retry.description: The policy for resubmitting the run. Defaults to `false`

max_duration.title: Max Duration
max_duration.description: The maximum duration of a run (e.g., `2h`, `1d`, etc) in a running state, excluding provisioning and pulling. After it elapses, the run is automatically stopped. Use `off` for unlimited duration. Defaults to `off`

stop_duration.title: Stop Duration
stop_duration.description: The maximum duration of a run graceful stopping. After it elapses, the run is automatically forced stopped. This includes force detaching volumes used by the run. Use `off` for unlimited duration. Defaults to `5m`

max_price.title: Max Price
max_price.description: The maximum instance price per hour, in dollars

creation_policy.description: The policy for using instances from fleets: `reuse`, `reuse-or-create`. Defaults to `reuse-or-create`

idle_duration.title: Idle Duration
idle_duration.description: Time to wait before terminating idle instances. Instances are not terminated if the fleet is already at `nodes.min`. Defaults to `5m` for runs and `3d` for fleets. Use `off` for unlimited duration

utilization_policy.title: Utilization Policy
utilization_policy.description: Run termination policy based on utilization

startup_order.description: The order in which master and workers jobs are started: `any`, `master-first`, `workers-first`. Defaults to `any`

stop_criteria.description: The criteria determining when a multi-node run should be considered finished: `all-done`, `master-done`. Defaults to `all-done`

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for starting the run at specified time

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The custom tags to associate with the resource. The tags are also propagated to the underlying backend resources. If there is a conflict with backend-level tags, does not override them

DstackBackendConfigRequest.title: DstackBackendConfigRequest
DstackBackendConfigRequest.description: This is a config model of DstackBackend stored in BackendModel.config and used by DstackConfigurator.

Env.title: Env
Env.description:
Env represents a mapping of process environment variables, as in environ(7).
Environment values may be omitted, in that case the :class:`EnvSentinel`
object is used as a placeholder.

To create an instance from a `dict[str, str]` or a `list[str]` use pydantic's
:meth:`BaseModel.parse_obj(dict | list)` method.

NB: this is *NOT* a CoreModel, pydantic-duality, which is used as a base
for the CoreModel, doesn't play well with custom root models.

actor_user_id.title: Actor User Id
actor_user_id.description: ID of the user who performed the action that triggered the event, or `null` if the action was performed by the system

actor_user.title: Actor User
actor_user.description: Name of the user who performed the action that triggered the event, or `null` if the action was performed by the system

is_actor_user_deleted.title: Is Actor User Deleted
is_actor_user_deleted.description: Whether the user who performed the action that triggered the event is deleted, or `null` if the action was performed by the system

targets.title: Targets
targets.description: List of entities affected by the event

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of the target entity. One of: `project`, `user`, `fleet`, `instance`, `run`, `job`, `volume`, `gateway`, `secret`

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: ID of the project the target entity belongs to, or `null` for target types not bound to a project (e.g., users)

project_name.title: Project Name
project_name.description: Name of the project the target entity belongs to, or `null` for target types not bound to a project (e.g., users)

is_project_deleted.title: Is Project Deleted
is_project_deleted.description: Whether the project the target entity belongs to is deleted, or `null` for target types not bound to a project (e.g., users)

local_path.title: Local Path
local_path.description: The path on the user's machine. Relative paths are resolved relative to the parent directory of the the configuration file

path.title: Path
path.description: The path in the container. Relative paths are resolved relative to the working directory

env.title: Env
env.description: The mapping or the list of environment variables

ssh_config.title: Ssh Config
ssh_config.description: The parameters for adding instances via SSH

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description: The number of instances in cloud fleet

reservation.title: Reservation
reservation.description: The existing reservation to use for instance provisioning. Supports AWS Capacity Reservations, AWS Capacity Blocks, and GCP reservations

blocks.title: Blocks
blocks.description: The amount of blocks to split the instance into, a number or `auto`. `auto` means as many as possible. The number of GPUs and CPUs must be divisible by the number of blocks. Defaults to `1`, i.e. do not split

backends.description: The backends to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[aws, gcp]`)

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The regions to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1, us-west4, westeurope]`)

availability_zones.title: Availability Zones
availability_zones.description: The availability zones to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1a, us-west4-a]`)

instance_types.title: Instance Types
instance_types.description: The cloud-specific instance types to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[p3.8xlarge, n1-standard-4]`)

spot_policy.description: The policy for provisioning spot or on-demand instances: `spot`, `on-demand`, `auto`. Defaults to `on-demand`

retry.title: Retry
retry.description: The policy for provisioning retry. Defaults to `false`

max_price.title: Max Price
max_price.description: The maximum instance price per hour, in dollars

idle_duration.title: Idle Duration
idle_duration.description: Time to wait before terminating idle instances. Instances are not terminated if the fleet is already at `nodes.min`. Defaults to `5m` for runs and `3d` for fleets. Use `off` for unlimited duration

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The custom tags to associate with the resource. The tags are also propagated to the underlying backend resources. If there is a conflict with backend-level tags, does not override them

min.title: Min
min.description: The minimum number of instances to maintain in the fleet

target.title: Target
target.description: The number of instances to provision on fleet apply. `min` <= `target` <= `max` Defaults to `min`

max.title: Max
max.description: The maximum number of instances allowed in the fleet. Unlimited if not specified

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of GCP regions. Omit to use all regions

vpc_name.title: Vpc Name
vpc_name.description: The name of a custom VPC. If not specified, the default VPC is used

extra_vpcs.title: Extra Vpcs
extra_vpcs.description: The names of additional VPCs used for multi-NIC instances, such as those that support GPUDirect. Specify eight VPCs to maximize bandwidth in clusters with eight-GPU instances. Each VPC must have a subnet and a firewall rule allowing internal traffic across all subnets

roce_vpcs.title: Roce Vpcs
roce_vpcs.description: The names of additional VPCs with the RoCE network profile. Used for RDMA on GPU instances that support the MRDMA interface type. A VPC should have eight subnets to maximize the bandwidth in clusters with eight-GPU instances.

vpc_project_id.title: Vpc Project Id
vpc_project_id.description: The shared VPC hosted project ID. Required for shared VPC only

public_ips.title: Public Ips
public_ips.description: A flag to enable/disable public IP assigning on instances. Defaults to `true`

nat_check.title: Nat Check
nat_check.description: A flag to enable/disable a check that Cloud NAT is configured for the VPC. This should be set to `false` when `public_ips: false` and outbound internet connectivity is provided by a mechanism other than Cloud NAT such as a third-party NAT appliance. Defaults to `true`

vm_service_account.title: Vm Service Account
vm_service_account.description: The service account to associate with provisioned VMs

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The tags (labels) that will be assigned to resources created by `dstack`

preview_features.title: Preview Features
preview_features.description: The list of preview GCP features to enable. There are currently no preview features

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of GCP regions. Omit to use all regions

vpc_name.title: Vpc Name
vpc_name.description: The name of a custom VPC. If not specified, the default VPC is used

extra_vpcs.title: Extra Vpcs
extra_vpcs.description: The names of additional VPCs used for multi-NIC instances, such as those that support GPUDirect. Specify eight VPCs to maximize bandwidth in clusters with eight-GPU instances. Each VPC must have a subnet and a firewall rule allowing internal traffic across all subnets

roce_vpcs.title: Roce Vpcs
roce_vpcs.description: The names of additional VPCs with the RoCE network profile. Used for RDMA on GPU instances that support the MRDMA interface type. A VPC should have eight subnets to maximize the bandwidth in clusters with eight-GPU instances.

vpc_project_id.title: Vpc Project Id
vpc_project_id.description: The shared VPC hosted project ID. Required for shared VPC only

public_ips.title: Public Ips
public_ips.description: A flag to enable/disable public IP assigning on instances. Defaults to `true`

nat_check.title: Nat Check
nat_check.description: A flag to enable/disable a check that Cloud NAT is configured for the VPC. This should be set to `false` when `public_ips: false` and outbound internet connectivity is provided by a mechanism other than Cloud NAT such as a third-party NAT appliance. Defaults to `true`

vm_service_account.title: Vm Service Account
vm_service_account.description: The service account to associate with provisioned VMs

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The tags (labels) that will be assigned to resources created by `dstack`

preview_features.title: Preview Features
preview_features.description: The list of preview GCP features to enable. There are currently no preview features

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: The path to the service account file

data.title: Data
data.description: The contents of the service account file

vendor.description: The vendor of the GPU/accelerator, one of: `nvidia`, `amd`, `google` (alias: `tpu`), `intel`

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the GPU (e.g., `A100` or `H100`)

memory.title: Memory
memory.description: The RAM size (e.g., `16GB`). Can be set to a range (e.g. `16GB..`, or `16GB..80GB`)

total_memory.title: Total Memory
total_memory.description: The total RAM size (e.g., `32GB`). Can be set to a range (e.g. `16GB..`, or `16GB..80GB`)

compute_capability.title: Compute Capability
compute_capability.description: The minimum compute capability of the GPU (e.g., `7.5`)

instance_type.title: Instance Type
instance_type.description: Backend-specific instance type to use for the gateway instance. Omit to use the backend's default, which is typically a small non-GPU instance

public_ip.title: Public Ip
public_ip.description: Allocate public IP for the gateway

certificate.title: Certificate
certificate.description: The SSL certificate configuration. Defaults to `type: lets-encrypt`

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The custom tags to associate with the gateway. The tags are also propagated to the underlying backend resources. If there is a conflict with backend-level tags, does not override them

repo_id.title: Repo Id
repo_id.description: A unique identifier of the repo

max_offers.title: Max Offers
max_offers.description: The maximum number of offers to return

GpuGroupRequest.title: GpuGroupRequest
GpuGroupRequest.description: GPU group that can handle all grouping scenarios.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the HTTP header

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the HTTP header

header.title: Header
header.description: Name of the header to use for partitioning

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Hot Aisle regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Hot Aisle regions. Omit to use all regions

instance_path.title: Instance Path
instance_path.description: The absolute path on the instance (host)

path.title: Path
path.description: The absolute path in the container

optional.title: Optional
optional.description: Allow running without this volume in backends that do not support instance volumes

JobRuntimeDataRequest.title: JobRuntimeDataRequest
JobRuntimeDataRequest.description:
Holds various information only available after the job is submitted, such as:
    * offer (depends on the instance)
    * volumes used by the job
    * resource constraints for container (depend on the instance)
    * port mapping (reported by the shim only after the container is started)

Some fields are mutable, for example, `ports` only available when the shim starts
the container.

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: The path to the kubeconfig file

data.title: Data
data.description: The contents of the kubeconfig file

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace for resources managed by `dstack`

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace for resources managed by `dstack`

hostname.title: Hostname
hostname.description: The external IP address or hostname of any node

port.title: Port
port.description: Any port accessible outside of the cluster

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Lambda regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Lambda regions. Omit to use all regions

target_projects.title: Target Projects
target_projects.description: List of project IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified projects

target_users.title: Target Users
target_users.description: List of user IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified users

target_fleets.title: Target Fleets
target_fleets.description: List of fleet IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified fleets

target_instances.title: Target Instances
target_instances.description: List of instance IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified instances

target_runs.title: Target Runs
target_runs.description: List of run IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified runs

target_jobs.title: Target Jobs
target_jobs.description: List of job IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified jobs

target_volumes.title: Target Volumes
target_volumes.description: List of volume IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified volumes

target_gateways.title: Target Gateways
target_gateways.description: List of gateway IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified gateways

target_secrets.title: Target Secrets
target_secrets.description: List of secret IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified secrets

within_projects.title: Within Projects
within_projects.description: List of project IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified projects or any entities within those projects

within_fleets.title: Within Fleets
within_fleets.description: List of fleet IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified fleets or instances within those fleets

within_runs.title: Within Runs
within_runs.description: List of run IDs. The response will only include events that target the specified runs or jobs within those runs

include_target_types.description: List of target types. The response will only include events that have a target of one of the specified types

actors.title: Actors
actors.description: List of user IDs or `null` values. The response will only include events about actions performed by the specified users, or performed by the system if `null` is specified

group_by.title: Group By
group_by.description: List of fields to group by. Valid values: 'backend', 'region', 'count'. Note: 'region' can only be used together with 'backend'.

ListGpusRequestRequest.title: ListGpusRequestRequest
ListGpusRequestRequest.description: Request for listing GPUs with optional grouping.

gpus.title: Gpus
gpus.description: List of GPU specifications, grouped according to the group_by parameter

include_not_joined.title: Include Not Joined
include_not_joined.description: Include public projects where user is not a member.

return_total_count.title: Return Total Count
return_total_count.description: Return `total_count` with the total number of projects.

name_pattern.title: Name Pattern
name_pattern.description: Include only projects with the name containing `name_pattern`.

prev_created_at.title: Prev Created At
prev_created_at.description: Paginate projects by specifying `created_at` of the last (first) project in previous batch for descending (ascending).

prev_id.title: Prev Id
prev_id.description: Paginate projects by specifying `id` of the last (first) project in previous batch for descending (ascending). Must be used together with `prev_created_at`.

ascending.title: Ascending
ascending.description: Return projects sorted by `created_at` in ascending order. Defaults to descending.

include_jobs.title: Include Jobs
include_jobs.description: Whether to include `jobs` in the response

job_submissions_limit.title: Job Submissions Limit
job_submissions_limit.description: Limit number of job submissions returned per job to avoid large responses.Drops older job submissions. No effect with `include_jobs: false`

return_total_count.title: Return Total Count
return_total_count.description: Return `total_count` with the total number of users.

name_pattern.title: Name Pattern
name_pattern.description: Include only users with the name containing `name_pattern`.

prev_created_at.title: Prev Created At
prev_created_at.description: Paginate users by specifying `created_at` of the last (first) user in previous batch for descending (ascending).

prev_id.title: Prev Id
prev_id.description: Paginate users by specifying `id` of the last (first) user in previous batch for descending (ascending). Must be used together with `prev_created_at`.

ascending.title: Ascending
ascending.description: Return users sorted by `created_at` in ascending order. Defaults to descending.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username or email of the user

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: The list of allowed Nebius project IDs. Omit to use the default project in each region. The project is considered default if it is the only project in the region or if its name starts with `default`

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of allowed Nebius regions. Omit to allow all regions

fabrics.title: Fabrics
fabrics.description: The list of allowed fabrics for InfiniBand clusters. Omit to allow all fabrics

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The tags (labels) that will be assigned to resources created by `dstack`

NebiusBackendConfigRequest.title: NebiusBackendConfigRequest
NebiusBackendConfigRequest.description:
The backend config used in the API, server/config.yml, `NebiusConfigurator`.
It also serves as a base class for other backend config models.
Should not include creds.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: The list of allowed Nebius project IDs. Omit to use the default project in each region. The project is considered default if it is the only project in the region or if its name starts with `default`

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of allowed Nebius regions. Omit to allow all regions

fabrics.title: Fabrics
fabrics.description: The list of allowed fabrics for InfiniBand clusters. Omit to allow all fabrics

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The tags (labels) that will be assigned to resources created by `dstack`

NebiusBackendConfigWithCredsRequest.title: NebiusBackendConfigWithCredsRequest
NebiusBackendConfigWithCredsRequest.description: Same as `NebiusBackendConfig` but also includes creds.

public_key_id.title: Public Key Id
public_key_id.description: ID of the service account public key

private_key_file.title: Private Key File
private_key_file.description: Path to the service account private key

private_key_content.title: Private Key Content
private_key_content.description: Content of the service account private key. When configuring via `server/config.yml`, it's automatically filled from `private_key_file`. When configuring via UI, it has to be specified explicitly.

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: The path to the service account credentials file

code.title: Code
code.description: The OAuth2 authorization code received from the provider in the redirect URL.

state.title: State
state.description: The state parameter received from the provider in the redirect URL.

redirect_url.title: Redirect Url
redirect_url.description: The URL that the user needs to be redirected to. If `null`, there is no next redirect.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the provider is configured on the server.

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of OCI regions. Omit to use all regions

compartment_id.title: Compartment Id
compartment_id.description: Compartment where `dstack` will create all resources. Omit to instruct `dstack` to create a new compartment

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of OCI regions. Omit to use all regions

compartment_id.title: Compartment Id
compartment_id.description: Compartment where `dstack` will create all resources. Omit to instruct `dstack` to create a new compartment

key_file.title: Key File
key_file.description: Path to the user's private PEM key. Either this or `key_content` should be set

key_content.title: Key Content
key_content.description: Content of the user's private PEM key. Either this or `key_file` should be set

pass_phrase.title: Pass Phrase
pass_phrase.description: Passphrase for the private PEM key if it is encrypted

region.title: Region
region.description: Name or key of any region the tenancy is subscribed to

file.title: File
file.description: Path to the OCI CLI-compatible config file

profile.title: Profile
profile.description: Profile to load from the config file

format.title: Format
format.description: The serving format. Must be set to `openai`

OpenAIChatModelRequest.title: OpenAIChatModelRequest
OpenAIChatModelRequest.description:
Mapping of the model for the OpenAI-compatible endpoint.

Attributes:
    type (str): The type of the model, e.g. "chat"
    name (str): The name of the model. This name will be used both to load model configuration from the HuggingFace Hub and in the OpenAI-compatible endpoint.
    format (str): The format of the model, i.e. "openai".
    prefix (str): The `base_url` prefix: `http://hostname/{prefix}/chat/completions`. Defaults to `/v1`.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL to request. Defaults to `/`

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method to use for the probe (e.g., `get`, `post`, etc.). Defaults to `get`

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: A list of HTTP headers to include in the request

body.title: Body
body.description: The HTTP request body to send with the probe

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Maximum amount of time the HTTP request is allowed to take. Defaults to `10s`

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: Minimum amount of time between the end of one probe execution and the start of the next. Defaults to `15s`

ready_after.title: Ready After
ready_after.description: The number of consecutive successful probe executions required for the replica to be considered ready. Used during rolling deployments. Defaults to `1`

backends.description: The backends to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[aws, gcp]`)

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The regions to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1, us-west4, westeurope]`)

availability_zones.title: Availability Zones
availability_zones.description: The availability zones to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1a, us-west4-a]`)

instance_types.title: Instance Types
instance_types.description: The cloud-specific instance types to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[p3.8xlarge, n1-standard-4]`)

reservation.title: Reservation
reservation.description: The existing reservation to use for instance provisioning. Supports AWS Capacity Reservations, AWS Capacity Blocks, and GCP reservations

spot_policy.description: The policy for provisioning spot or on-demand instances: `spot`, `on-demand`, `auto`. Defaults to `on-demand`

retry.title: Retry
retry.description: The policy for resubmitting the run. Defaults to `false`

max_duration.title: Max Duration
max_duration.description: The maximum duration of a run (e.g., `2h`, `1d`, etc) in a running state, excluding provisioning and pulling. After it elapses, the run is automatically stopped. Use `off` for unlimited duration. Defaults to `off`

stop_duration.title: Stop Duration
stop_duration.description: The maximum duration of a run graceful stopping. After it elapses, the run is automatically forced stopped. This includes force detaching volumes used by the run. Use `off` for unlimited duration. Defaults to `5m`

max_price.title: Max Price
max_price.description: The maximum instance price per hour, in dollars

creation_policy.description: The policy for using instances from fleets: `reuse`, `reuse-or-create`. Defaults to `reuse-or-create`

idle_duration.title: Idle Duration
idle_duration.description: Time to wait before terminating idle instances. Instances are not terminated if the fleet is already at `nodes.min`. Defaults to `5m` for runs and `3d` for fleets. Use `off` for unlimited duration

utilization_policy.title: Utilization Policy
utilization_policy.description: Run termination policy based on utilization

startup_order.description: The order in which master and workers jobs are started: `any`, `master-first`, `workers-first`. Defaults to `any`

stop_criteria.description: The criteria determining when a multi-node run should be considered finished: `all-done`, `master-done`. Defaults to `all-done`

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for starting the run at specified time

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The custom tags to associate with the resource. The tags are also propagated to the underlying backend resources. If there is a conflict with backend-level tags, does not override them

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the profile that can be passed as `--profile` to `dstack apply`

default.title: Default
default.description: If set to true, `dstack apply` will use this profile by default.

on_events.description: The list of events that should be handled with retry. Supported events are `no-capacity`, `interruption`, `error`. Omit to retry on all events

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The maximum period of retrying the run, e.g., `4h` or `1d`. The period is calculated as a run age for `no-capacity` event and as a time passed since the last `interruption` and `error` for `interruption` and `error` events.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: URL path prefix to which this limit is applied. If an incoming request matches several prefixes, the longest prefix is applied

key.title: Key
key.description: The partitioning key. Each incoming request belongs to a partition and rate limits are applied per partition. Defaults to partitioning by client IP address

rps.title: Rps
rps.description: Max allowed number of requests per second. Requests are tracked at millisecond granularity. For example, `rps: 10` means at most 1 request per 100ms

burst.title: Burst
burst.description: Max number of requests that can be passed to the service ahead of the rate limit

RegistryAuthRequest.title: RegistryAuthRequest
RegistryAuthRequest.description:
Credentials for pulling a private Docker image.

Attributes:
    username (str): The username
    password (str): The password or access token

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the replica group. If not provided, defaults to '0', '1', etc. based on position.

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of replicas. Can be a number (e.g. `2`) or a range (`0..4` or `1..8`). If it's a range, the `scaling` property is required

scaling.title: Scaling
scaling.description: The auto-scaling rules. Required if `count` is set to a range

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: The resources requirements for replicas in this group

commands.title: Commands
commands.description: The shell commands to run for replicas in this group

local_path.title: Local Path
local_path.description: The path to the Git repo on the user's machine. Relative paths are resolved relative to the parent directory of the the configuration file. Mutually exclusive with `url`

url.title: Url
url.description: The Git repo URL. Mutually exclusive with `local_path`

branch.title: Branch
branch.description: The repo branch. Defaults to the active branch for local paths and the default branch for URLs

path.title: Path
path.description: The repo path inside the run container. Relative paths are resolved relative to the working directory

if_exists.description: The action to be taken if `path` exists and is not empty. One of: `error`, `skip`

shm_size.title: Shm Size
shm_size.description: The size of shared memory (e.g., `8GB`). If you are using parallel communicating processes (e.g., dataloaders in PyTorch), you may need to configure this

run_name.title: Run Name
run_name.description: The run name. If not set, the run name is generated automatically.

repo_id.title: Repo Id
repo_id.description: Same `repo_id` that is specified when initializing the repo by calling the `/api/project/{project_name}/repos/init` endpoint. If not specified, a default virtual repo is used.

repo_data.title: Repo Data
repo_data.description: The repo data such as the current branch and commit.

repo_code_hash.title: Repo Code Hash
repo_code_hash.description: The hash of the repo diff. Can be omitted if there is no repo diff.

repo_dir.title: Repo Dir
repo_dir.description: The repo path inside the container. Relative paths are resolved relative to the working directory.

file_archives.title: File Archives
file_archives.description: The list of file archive ID to container path mappings.

configuration_path.title: Configuration Path
configuration_path.description: The path to the run configuration YAML file. It can be omitted when using the programmatic API.

ssh_key_pub.title: Ssh Key Pub
ssh_key_pub.description: The contents of the SSH public key that will be used to connect to the run. Can be empty only before the run is submitted.

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of RunPod regions. Omit to use all regions

community_cloud.title: Community Cloud
community_cloud.description: Whether Community Cloud offers can be suggested in addition to Secure Cloud. Defaults to `true`

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of RunPod regions. Omit to use all regions

community_cloud.title: Community Cloud
community_cloud.description: Whether Community Cloud offers can be suggested in addition to Secure Cloud. Defaults to `true`

hostname.title: Hostname
hostname.description: The IP address or domain to connect to

port.title: Port
port.description: The SSH port to connect to for this host

user.title: User
user.description: The user to log in with for this host

identity_file.title: Identity File
identity_file.description: The private key to use for this host

proxy_jump.title: Proxy Jump
proxy_jump.description: The SSH proxy configuration for this host

internal_ip.title: Internal Ip
internal_ip.description: The internal IP of the host used for communication inside the cluster. If not specified, `dstack` will use the IP address from `network` or from the first found internal network.

blocks.title: Blocks
blocks.description: The amount of blocks to split the instance into, a number or `auto`. `auto` means as many as possible. The number of GPUs and CPUs must be divisible by the number of blocks. Defaults to `1`, i.e. do not split

user.title: User
user.description: The user to log in with on all hosts

port.title: Port
port.description: The SSH port to connect to

identity_file.title: Identity File
identity_file.description: The private key to use for all hosts

proxy_jump.title: Proxy Jump
proxy_jump.description: The SSH proxy configuration for all hosts

hosts.title: Hosts
hosts.description: The per host connection parameters: a hostname or an object that overrides default ssh parameters

network.title: Network
network.description: The network address for cluster setup in the format `<ip>/<netmask>`. `dstack` will use IP addresses from this network for communication between hosts. If not specified, `dstack` will use IPs from the first found internal network.

hostname.title: Hostname
hostname.description: The IP address or domain of proxy host

port.title: Port
port.description: The SSH port of proxy host

user.title: User
user.description: The user to log in with for proxy host

identity_file.title: Identity File
identity_file.description: The private key to use for proxy host

repo_id.title: Repo Id
repo_id.description: A unique identifier of the repo

repo_creds.title: Repo Creds
repo_creds.description: The repo creds for accessing private remote repo

metric.title: Metric
metric.description: The target metric to track. Currently, the only supported value is `rps` (meaning requests per second)

target.title: Target
target.description: The target value of the metric. The number of replicas is calculated based on this number and automatically adjusts (scales up or down) as this metric changes

scale_up_delay.title: Scale Up Delay
scale_up_delay.description: The delay in seconds before scaling up

scale_down_delay.title: Scale Down Delay
scale_down_delay.description: The delay in seconds before scaling down

cron.title: Cron
cron.description: A cron expression or a list of cron expressions specifying the UTC time when the run needs to be started

port.title: Port
port.description: The port the application listens on

gateway.title: Gateway
gateway.description: The name of the gateway. Specify boolean `false` to run without a gateway. Specify boolean `true` to run with the default gateway. Omit to run with the default gateway if there is one, or without a gateway otherwise

strip_prefix.title: Strip Prefix
strip_prefix.description: Strip the `/proxy/services/<project name>/<run name>/` path prefix when forwarding requests to the service. Only takes effect when running the service without a gateway

model.title: Model
model.description: Mapping of the model for the OpenAI-compatible endpoint provided by `dstack`. Can be a full model format definition or just a model name. If it's a name, the service is expected to expose an OpenAI-compatible API at the `/v1` path

https.title: Https
https.description: Enable HTTPS if running with a gateway

scaling.title: Scaling
scaling.description: The auto-scaling rules. Required if `replicas` is set to a range

probes.title: Probes
probes.description: List of probes used to determine job health

replicas.title: Replicas
replicas.description: The number of replicas or a list of replica groups. Can be an integer (e.g., `2`), a range (e.g., `0..4`), or a list of replica groups. Each replica group defines replicas with shared configuration (commands, resources, scaling). When `replicas` is a list of replica groups, top-level `scaling`, `commands`, and `resources` are not allowed and must be specified in each replica group instead.

name.title: Name
name.description: The run name. If not specified, a random name is generated

image.title: Image
image.description: The name of the Docker image to run

user.title: User
user.description: The user inside the container, `user_name_or_id[:group_name_or_id]` (e.g., `ubuntu`, `1000:1000`). Defaults to the default user from the `image`

privileged.title: Privileged
privileged.description: Run the container in privileged mode

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: The absolute path to the working directory inside the container. Defaults to the `image`'s default working directory

registry_auth.title: Registry Auth
registry_auth.description: Credentials for pulling a private Docker image

python.description: The major version of Python. Mutually exclusive with `image` and `docker`

nvcc.title: Nvcc
nvcc.description: Use image with NVIDIA CUDA Compiler (NVCC) included. Mutually exclusive with `image` and `docker`

single_branch.title: Single Branch
single_branch.description: Whether to clone and track only the current branch or all remote branches. Relevant only when using remote Git repos. Defaults to `false` for dev environments and to `true` for tasks and services

env.title: Env
env.description: The mapping or the list of environment variables

shell.title: Shell
shell.description: The shell used to run commands. Allowed values are `sh`, `bash`, or an absolute path, e.g., `/usr/bin/zsh`. Defaults to `/bin/sh` if the `image` is specified, `/bin/bash` otherwise

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: The resources requirements to run the configuration

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of the run, an integer between `0` and `100`. `dstack` tries to provision runs with higher priority first. Defaults to `0`

docker.title: Docker
docker.description: Use Docker inside the container. Mutually exclusive with `image`, `python`, and `nvcc`. Overrides `privileged`

files.title: Files
files.description: The local to container file path mappings

backends.description: The backends to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[aws, gcp]`)

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The regions to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1, us-west4, westeurope]`)

availability_zones.title: Availability Zones
availability_zones.description: The availability zones to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1a, us-west4-a]`)

instance_types.title: Instance Types
instance_types.description: The cloud-specific instance types to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[p3.8xlarge, n1-standard-4]`)

reservation.title: Reservation
reservation.description: The existing reservation to use for instance provisioning. Supports AWS Capacity Reservations, AWS Capacity Blocks, and GCP reservations

spot_policy.description: The policy for provisioning spot or on-demand instances: `spot`, `on-demand`, `auto`. Defaults to `on-demand`

retry.title: Retry
retry.description: The policy for resubmitting the run. Defaults to `false`

max_duration.title: Max Duration
max_duration.description: The maximum duration of a run (e.g., `2h`, `1d`, etc) in a running state, excluding provisioning and pulling. After it elapses, the run is automatically stopped. Use `off` for unlimited duration. Defaults to `off`

stop_duration.title: Stop Duration
stop_duration.description: The maximum duration of a run graceful stopping. After it elapses, the run is automatically forced stopped. This includes force detaching volumes used by the run. Use `off` for unlimited duration. Defaults to `5m`

max_price.title: Max Price
max_price.description: The maximum instance price per hour, in dollars

creation_policy.description: The policy for using instances from fleets: `reuse`, `reuse-or-create`. Defaults to `reuse-or-create`

idle_duration.title: Idle Duration
idle_duration.description: Time to wait before terminating idle instances. Instances are not terminated if the fleet is already at `nodes.min`. Defaults to `5m` for runs and `3d` for fleets. Use `off` for unlimited duration

utilization_policy.title: Utilization Policy
utilization_policy.description: Run termination policy based on utilization

startup_order.description: The order in which master and workers jobs are started: `any`, `master-first`, `workers-first`. Defaults to `any`

stop_criteria.description: The criteria determining when a multi-node run should be considered finished: `all-done`, `master-done`. Defaults to `all-done`

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for starting the run at specified time

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The custom tags to associate with the resource. The tags are also propagated to the underlying backend resources. If there is a conflict with backend-level tags, does not override them

base_url.title: Base Url
base_url.description: Full URL or path relative to dstack-server's base URL

url.title: Url
url.description: Full URL or path relative to dstack-server's base URL

abort.title: Abort
abort.description: Do not wait for a graceful shutdown.

format.title: Format
format.description: The serving format. Must be set to `tgi`

chat_template.title: Chat Template
chat_template.description: The custom prompt template for the model. If not specified, the default prompt template from the HuggingFace Hub configuration will be used

eos_token.title: Eos Token
eos_token.description: The custom end of sentence token. If not specified, the default end of sentence token from the HuggingFace Hub configuration will be used

TGIChatModelRequest.title: TGIChatModelRequest
TGIChatModelRequest.description:
Mapping of the model for the OpenAI-compatible endpoint.

Attributes:
    type (str): The type of the model, e.g. "chat"
    name (str): The name of the model. This name will be used both to load model configuration from the HuggingFace Hub and in the OpenAI-compatible endpoint.
    format (str): The format of the model, e.g. "tgi" if the model is served with HuggingFace's Text Generation Inference.
    chat_template (Optional[str]): The custom prompt template for the model. If not specified, the default prompt template from the HuggingFace Hub configuration will be used.
    eos_token (Optional[str]): The custom end of sentence token. If not specified, the default end of sentence token from the HuggingFace Hub configuration will be used.

name.title: Name
name.description: The run name. If not specified, a random name is generated

image.title: Image
image.description: The name of the Docker image to run

user.title: User
user.description: The user inside the container, `user_name_or_id[:group_name_or_id]` (e.g., `ubuntu`, `1000:1000`). Defaults to the default user from the `image`

privileged.title: Privileged
privileged.description: Run the container in privileged mode

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: The absolute path to the working directory inside the container. Defaults to the `image`'s default working directory

registry_auth.title: Registry Auth
registry_auth.description: Credentials for pulling a private Docker image

python.description: The major version of Python. Mutually exclusive with `image` and `docker`

nvcc.title: Nvcc
nvcc.description: Use image with NVIDIA CUDA Compiler (NVCC) included. Mutually exclusive with `image` and `docker`

single_branch.title: Single Branch
single_branch.description: Whether to clone and track only the current branch or all remote branches. Relevant only when using remote Git repos. Defaults to `false` for dev environments and to `true` for tasks and services

env.title: Env
env.description: The mapping or the list of environment variables

shell.title: Shell
shell.description: The shell used to run commands. Allowed values are `sh`, `bash`, or an absolute path, e.g., `/usr/bin/zsh`. Defaults to `/bin/sh` if the `image` is specified, `/bin/bash` otherwise

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: The resources requirements to run the configuration

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of the run, an integer between `0` and `100`. `dstack` tries to provision runs with higher priority first. Defaults to `0`

docker.title: Docker
docker.description: Use Docker inside the container. Mutually exclusive with `image`, `python`, and `nvcc`. Overrides `privileged`

files.title: Files
files.description: The local to container file path mappings

backends.description: The backends to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[aws, gcp]`)

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The regions to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1, us-west4, westeurope]`)

availability_zones.title: Availability Zones
availability_zones.description: The availability zones to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[eu-west-1a, us-west4-a]`)

instance_types.title: Instance Types
instance_types.description: The cloud-specific instance types to consider for provisioning (e.g., `[p3.8xlarge, n1-standard-4]`)

reservation.title: Reservation
reservation.description: The existing reservation to use for instance provisioning. Supports AWS Capacity Reservations, AWS Capacity Blocks, and GCP reservations

spot_policy.description: The policy for provisioning spot or on-demand instances: `spot`, `on-demand`, `auto`. Defaults to `on-demand`

retry.title: Retry
retry.description: The policy for resubmitting the run. Defaults to `false`

max_duration.title: Max Duration
max_duration.description: The maximum duration of a run (e.g., `2h`, `1d`, etc) in a running state, excluding provisioning and pulling. After it elapses, the run is automatically stopped. Use `off` for unlimited duration. Defaults to `off`

stop_duration.title: Stop Duration
stop_duration.description: The maximum duration of a run graceful stopping. After it elapses, the run is automatically forced stopped. This includes force detaching volumes used by the run. Use `off` for unlimited duration. Defaults to `5m`

max_price.title: Max Price
max_price.description: The maximum instance price per hour, in dollars

creation_policy.description: The policy for using instances from fleets: `reuse`, `reuse-or-create`. Defaults to `reuse-or-create`

idle_duration.title: Idle Duration
idle_duration.description: Time to wait before terminating idle instances. Instances are not terminated if the fleet is already at `nodes.min`. Defaults to `5m` for runs and `3d` for fleets. Use `off` for unlimited duration

utilization_policy.title: Utilization Policy
utilization_policy.description: Run termination policy based on utilization

startup_order.description: The order in which master and workers jobs are started: `any`, `master-first`, `workers-first`. Defaults to `any`

stop_criteria.description: The criteria determining when a multi-node run should be considered finished: `all-done`, `master-done`. Defaults to `all-done`

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for starting the run at specified time

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The custom tags to associate with the resource. The tags are also propagated to the underlying backend resources. If there is a conflict with backend-level tags, does not override them

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of TensorDock regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of TensorDock regions. Omit to use all regions

min_gpu_utilization.title: Min Gpu Utilization
min_gpu_utilization.description: Minimum required GPU utilization, percent. If any GPU has utilization below specified value during the whole time window, the run is terminated

time_window.title: Time Window
time_window.description: The time window of metric samples taking into account to measure utilization (e.g., `30m`, `1h`). Minimum is `5m`

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of VastAI regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of VastAI regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Verda regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Verda regions. Omit to use all regions

size.title: Size
size.description: The volume size. Must be specified when creating new volumes

volume_id.title: Volume Id
volume_id.description: The volume ID. Must be specified when registering external volumes

auto_cleanup_duration.title: Auto Cleanup Duration
auto_cleanup_duration.description: Time to wait after volume is no longer used by any job before deleting it. Defaults to keep the volume indefinitely. Use the value 'off' or -1 to disable auto-cleanup.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The custom tags to associate with the volume. The tags are also propagated to the underlying backend resources. If there is a conflict with backend-level tags, does not override them

name.title: Name
name.description: The network volume name or the list of network volume names to mount. If a list is specified, one of the volumes in the list will be mounted. Specify volumes from different backends/regions to increase availability

path.title: Path
path.description: The absolute container path to mount the volume at

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Vultr regions. Omit to use all regions

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: The list of Vultr regions. Omit to use all regions
